bug.short_desc: When trying to restore files, duplicity hands and complains about missing python2-pexpect
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
0.7.07.1-1.fc24
How reproducible:
I'm using par2+s3+http:// backend, but probably others will fail too. I'm not sure which module has a requirement on pexpect, specifically, though.
Steps to Reproduce:
duplicity par2+s3+http://bucket ~/test Synchronizing remote metadata to local cache... GnuPG passphrase: Copying duplicity-inc.20160630T055216Z.to.20160630T063131Z.manifest.gpg to local cache. Attempt 1 failed. ImportError: No module named pexpect Attempt 2 failed. ImportError: No module named pexpect Attempt 3 failed. ImportError: No module named pexpect Attempt 4 failed. ImportError: No module named pexpect Giving up after 5 attempts. ImportError: No module named pexpect
Additional info:
Works perfectly fine after installing python2-pexpect, so we probably need a Requires: for that.
duplicity-0.7.07.1-2.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-18d4547a34
duplicity-0.7.07.1-2.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-2ae963a6b8
duplicity-0.7.07.1-2.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-5e0ae2ac51

Jon, EPEL 7 is failing on Requires: python-pexpect. Are you sure you meant to package version 0.7 into EPEL? It's currently sitting at 0.6.26 (stable) and wasn't expecting that to change. (But would welcome it if it did anyway?, just seems unusual to version bump like that in EPEL)
Error: Package: duplicity-0.7.07.1-2.el7.x86_64 (/duplicity-0.7.07.1-2.el7.x86_64) Requires: python-pexpect You could try using --skip-broken to work around the problem
The F24 package does however correctly bring in python2-pexpect, and works as intended.

I'm sure, I had a previous build in just for the upgrade.
Re: python-pexpect, there's a build out there for epel7 but I see that it's not tagged, and this branch is retired.
leigh123linux@googlemail.com, why was this retired?
I understand, thanks for the clarification. This goes for bug 1336378 as well.

python-pexpect was not allowed to exist in epel7 because there is rhel7 core package, pexpect. Could you fix your dependency to correct package name.
